Carla Culligan <cculligan@mhhlaw.net> Tue, Sep 3, 2024 at 8:40 AM
To: "blaine35010@gmail.com" <blaine35010@gmail.com>
Hey Blaine,
I could not forward this from my phone for some reason.
This was Matt’s response.
Thanks,
Carla
From: Matt Holdren <matt@agricolalaw.com>
Sent: Friday, August 30, 2024 10:16 AM
To: Carla Culligan <cculligan@mhhlaw.net>
Cc: Tom Young <tyoung@mhhlaw.net>; Barbara Agricola <barbara@agricolalaw.com>; Aria Barjis
<aria@agricolalaw.com>
Subject: Re: Counter Proposal - McGregor/Gilliland
Carla--
Per Barbi, the proposed order you sent over is unacceptable for a few reasons:
1. Set Day for Weekly Dinners: The court was very clear that the weekly dinners should take place on Wednesdays.
This specific day was ordered to ensure consistency, and we cannot agree to an arrangement that allows for
variability based on schedules. This was a critical part of the court's ruling, and it must be reflected accurately in
the order.
2. Reunification Therapy: The reunification therapy cannot be subject to A.K.’s activities. If we allow it to be
contingent upon her schedule, there is a risk that it will never happen. The court emphasized the importance of this
therapy, and it should take precedence over other activities.
3. Payment of Expenses: The expenses for the reunification therapy should not be solely the responsibility of the
mother. The costs must be split in accordance with the divorce decree.
These are all extremely reasonable edits. We are simply trying to do what's in the best interests of this child. Please
revise the proposed order accordingly and resend it for review.
-m
Agricola Law

-m

Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Tue, Sep 3, 2024 at 9:22 AM
To: Carla Culligan <cculligan@mhhlaw.net>
Thank you!
Is the plan to still submit both orders to the judge & allow him to make a decision?
I was in the courtroom & the judge NEVER said anything about Wednesday or specific day for the weekly dinners. His
exact words were, "Breakfast, Lunch, or Dinner whenever you can fit it in once per week". He also never once said that
AK had to miss her School related activities & she worked very very hard to make the cheer team at ACMS & it's not fair
for her to miss her games because they refuse to work around her scheduled school activities.
Do you happen to have the proposed order that Tom sent to them?
Thanks again for sending this again this morning! :)
Have a great week!
[Quoted text hidden]

To: Carla Culligan <cculligan@mhhlaw.net>
